Pre-Game Insights: Sunil Chhetri wants to win the match to give India a great chance to go to the third round, which they have never been to.
Chhetri is confident that the team will have tremendous support from the Kolkata crowd.
Chhetri wants the team to qualify for the third round and play against top teams in Asia, including Japan and Australia.
Chhetri is at peace with his decision to retire and feels that he has given everything he had.
Chhetri believes that this is the right time for him to retire and that the current setup is one of the biggest games he will play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chhetri's farewell match is on June 6, 2024, against Kuwait.
Chhetri's career will come to an end after the match, and he will become a fan, watching the team play from the stands.
Chhetri has been visualizing his life as a fan, wearing a suit and watching the team play.
Chhetri's legacy will live on, and he will be remembered as one of the greatest football players in India's history.
Others: Chhetri has played 19 years for the national team and has scored over 100 international goals.
Chhetri is an icon not just in India but globally, and his numbers will never be achieved again.
Chhetri's final match will be the 151st time he will don the India shirt.
